name: Church Numerals - Prefix is Overrated
description: In lambda calculus, the only primitive are lambdas. No booleans, no strings, and of course no numbers. Everything is reduced to anonymous functions. Church numbers are defined thusly: ```lambdacalc 0 = \ f x . x 1 = \ f x . f x 2 = \ f x . f (f x) 3 = \ f x . f (f (f x)) and so on .. ``` Your task will be to implement basic operators on numbers ( using only lambdas and function application ) : `add`, `mul`, and `sub`. ## However! Your combinators will not be applied in prefix position, but in infix position instead. To make this at all possible, they will consist of single letters, like this: ```lambdacalc 2 a d d 3 -> 5 2 m u l 3 -> 6 2 s u b 3 -> 0 # subtractions that would normally result in negative values should return 0 3 s u b 2 -> 1 ``` Actual testing will be extensional; the resulting function should behave correctly as a Church number, but need not be built strictly to the above definition. Yes, you can only define one `u`. ## For Bonus Points and Bragging Rights `pow` is missing! If you can make `pow` work, please publish a fork with the additional testing and earn Eternal Bragging Rights ( or at least until Christmas ). Both `0^0 = 1` and `0^0 = 0` are acceptable.
